item.title: Ticket #2775 (Ability for all users to add users with less capabilities) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Roles aren't proper subsets of each other though. A hierarchy cannot be assumed, especially in environments where people have tweaked the roles with the Role Manager plugin. Eliminating the confusion of hierarchical user editing was one of primary goals when designing the capability system. If you want this, it should be a plugin. As skeltoac mentioned, we'll happily add new plugin hooks if necessary.

item.title: Ticket #2775 (Ability for all users to add users with less capabilities) updated
item.dc:creator: doit-cu
item.description:
After thinking about it, I agree. I think the best way to approach this would be maybe more of a bugfix. Users who have the edit_user capability shouldn't be able to edit users who's capabilities are not a proper subset of the editing user's capabilities. True, you don't have to worry about this in the default installation. Instead of enabling this as a feature, why not fix that piece and then people who manage their roles outside the default are protected from that kind of vulnerability. I don't think I'm alone here- there are plugins for role managment if I remember correctly.

This is looking like it won't be too terrible to code up. Basically it involves adding a capabilities comparison function to the WP_Roles class and a few extra checks in addition to the current if(!current_user_can('edit_users')) deal.

Thoughts?

item.title: Ticket #2775 (Ability for all users to add users with less capabilities) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: I don't want editors adding authors, authors adding contributors, etc. I understand that you might want this, so I encourage you to write or commission a plugin to manupulate the roles and capabilities. Maybe the API needs some work before this can be done, in which case the hooks will almost certainly be cheerfully added.

item.title: Ticket #2774 (\${1} causing problems for people) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: 4.2 bites us in the ass again.

item.title: Ticket #2774 (\${1} causing problems for people) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Looking at the more recent info in that support thread we are relying on something introduced in PHP 4.3.0 which is newer than some people are using.

​http://wordpress.org/about/requirements/ says we need PHP 4.2

item.title: Ticket #1371 (Allowing HTML in post titles) updated
item.dc:creator: ranchnachos
item.description:
As a non-developer and a large user of wordpress, I have to say this idea is rediculous. I can understand that this probably is an easy fix, but if you want to style post titles, that's what you use CSS for.

Adding support for post titles will just add more cruft to users' web pages. It's suppose to be about seperation of style from content, not allowing them to style their content directly from the editor, which is the complete opposite of everything Wordpress stands for(in my opinion, of course).

Just my .02

item.title: Ticket #2775 (Ability for all users to add users with less capabilities) created
item.dc:creator: doit-cu
item.description:
It would ease some administration of large deployments if users could add other users with roles that had a subset of their capabilities. For example, in cases where subscription is not to be open to the general public, if authors could add subscribers. This should probably be optional, as some deployments might want to more tightly control access. If this is of interest, I can create a patch.

Thank you for your attention, --Joel

item.title: Ticket #2773 (mysql server connections are being left open causing low system ...) closed
item.dc:creator: masquerade

invalid:

Westi is right, see: ​http://php.net/mysql_close

Closing as invalid.

item.title: Ticket #2773 (mysql server connections are being left open causing low system ...) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
WordPress doesn't open persistent connections it uses ​mysql_connect not ​mysql_pconnect.

It doesn't explicitly call ​mysql_close but the connection should be closed implictly by PHP when script execution ends.

item.title: Ticket #2773 (mysql server connections are being left open causing low system ...) created
item.dc:creator: oncidium
item.description:
My website has been having connection problems on and off. According to my web provider the problem is wordpress...these were his comments.

"It’s the fact that it opens up connections to the database and then doesn’t close them,Its consuming system resources that are required to run other things,

We are running 2 GB of ram and mysql right now is hording over 65% and this is due to open connections." persistent connections...any way to fix this?

item.title: Ticket #2772 (Impossible to join the notify list on wordpress.org) created
item.dc:creator: gregh
item.description:
Problem:

It is impossible to join the notify list linked to from almost every page on wordpress.org.

To reproduce:

Go to ​http://wordpress.org/list/ and enter a username (optional) and email (compulsory).

Expected results:

Receive a confirmation email.

Actual results:

No email received ever, regardless of whether you specify a username or not. No release announcements received ever.

Workaround:

Subscribe to RSS feed feed://wordpress.org/development/feed/ instead.

Discussion:

This problem with the notify list has existed for months (years even?). I have tried various times over to suscribe the list and have never once received a confirmation email from wordpress.org. I have never received a release announcement. Given that WordPress is a publicly-deployed piece of software with a track record of security holes, it is very important to receive notification of new releases. I am hoping that this can be fixed soon as it is not very professional and it reflects badly on WordPress and the WordPress website.

item.title: Ticket #2770 (division by zero) created
item.dc:creator: sinergy
item.description:
wordpress occurs a php errormessage: division by zero.

in wp-admin: options -> reading blogsite: show the last X entries.

if you set X to 0, you will get:

Warning: Division by zero in /mydir/wp-includes/template-functions-links.php on line 512

it would be nice to receive an userfriendly wordpress message that it is not possible to set the entries to 0.

item.title: Ticket #2769 (Non-integer provided as page_id reveals a bug on pages list) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Owner, Status, Component, Severity, Summary changed

It seems that if page_id is not an integer, it is removed from the query altogether (latest trunk) 

ELECT * FROM wp_posts  WHERE (post_type = 'page' AND post_status = 'publish')    ORDER BY post_title ASC

No SQL injection potential. Although, blank page_id should probably run a front page query, not a query of all pages!

I'm taking away the "security" marking for this bug, because non-integer data isn't be inserted into the query. In the future, if you thing you've identified a security issue, please send it to security@…

item.title: Ticket #2769 (Non-integer provided as page_id reveals a bug on pages list) created
item.dc:creator: pcdinh
item.description:
I work with Wordpress 2.1 alpha1 build 2/6/2006 and find that if I send a request like this

​http://path/wordpress/?page_id=, or

​http://192.168.1.104/php/wordpress/?page_id=char()

or

​http://192.168.1.104/php/wordpress/?page_id=%3Cscript%3E

Live example: ​http://www.binarymoon.co.uk/?page_id=%22.%22%20or%201%20=%201%22.

I will have a list of all pages following by comments blocks displayed repeatly. It means that page_id is not checked against integer values.

Thanks

pcdinh

item.title: Ticket #2391 (User defined thumbnail size) updated
item.dc:creator: cheahk
item.description:
Personally, I have hardcoded my own thumbnail size that I need for my own site, but it needs to have more flexibility.

I would, however, like to see a default size for the thumbnail on the options page.

It would also be nice to have the upload box take that default size (set from the options page), but also have a couple of preset sizes to select, eg: 128x96, 256x192, 384x288, etc. Different thumbnail sizes would/could help enhance a page dramatically, IMHO.

item.title: Ticket #2768 (quotation marks are double escaped when editing a comment) created
item.dc:creator: arnee
item.description:
Happens since 2.0.3 (since nonces were introduced)

  1. Create a comment
  2. Got to Manage -> Comments
  3. Click "Edit comment"
  4. Edit something in the text and use quotation marks (" or ')
  5. Click Save
  6. You will be saked if you really want to do this? Missing nonce?
  7. Click Yes
  8. Check your blog or go back to Manage -> Comments
  9. All quotation marks are escaped with backslash (\)

Linux, Apache, PHP 4.2.2, php.ini:

  • magic_quotes_gpc On
  • magic_quotes_runtime Off
  • magic_quotes_sybase Off

There is no way to edit the comment without that these backslashes appear.

item.title: Ticket #2767 (Missing tags (2.0.2, 2.0.3) from Subversion repository) created
item.dc:creator: gregh
item.description:
I know this has been previously discussed on the mailing lists after the 2.0.2 release, but 2.0.3 is out and the problem still hasn't been addressed. Specifically, there are no tags for version 2.0.2, and now for 2.0.3 in the repository:

​http://trac.wordpress.org/browser/tags/

The excuse offered in the past was some kind of unspecified technical difficulty, but I wonder what's so difficult about tagging these releases seeing as all the other svn operations seem to be in regular use and working fine. Without this tag it makes upgrading via svn less convenient. Updating using the 2.0 branch would be an alternative, but if the developers aren't creating tags for each point release, how can we be sure that they're keeping the 2.0 branch in the repository up to date as well?

item.title: Ticket #2766 (Wordpress goes blank randomly) created
item.dc:creator: suexID
item.description:
I've found that problem after changing my custom made skin to an other one. (They're the same, I've just changed the CSS file)

My Wordpress blog goes totally blank in indeterminable intervals. Everything works fine (I mean that the RSS feeds are showing up well, the admin interface works fine), but I find a totally blank page instead of the index, archives, single post pages. The quickfix of this problem is to go to the Presentation panel in the admin interface and select one of the available themes. Then everything is allright, but after a few hours the problem occurs again.

Can somebody help me?

item.title: Ticket #2763 (get_post_status should use post_status = inherit instead of post_type ...) created
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description:
The function get_post_status gets the inherited post_status if the post_type = 'attachment', but shouldn't it test if post_status = 'inherit' instead? I'm attempting to allow attachments to be marked "private" regardless of their parent post/page's status. It's my assumption that by default, attachments have post_status = 'inherit', so changing this line shouldn't break anything.

get_post_status should be: 

function get_post_status($ID = '') {
	$post = get_post($ID);
	if ( is_object($post) ) {
		if ( ('inherit' == $post->post_status) && $post->post_parent && ($post->ID != $post->post_parent) )
			return get_post_status($post->post_parent);
		else
			return $post->post_status;
	}
	return false;
}

item.title: Ticket #2762 (manage_posts_custom_column bug) created
item.dc:creator: kriz
item.description:
If you use the manage_posts_custom_column action, in your function you won't get the post id. wp-admin/edit.php row 219:

<td><?php do_action('manage_posts_custom_column', $column_name, $id); ?></td>

I think it should be this:

<td><?php do_action('manage_posts_custom_column', array($column_name, $post->ID)); ?></td>

item.title: Ticket #2758 (Security issue: cat parameter is vunerable to sql injection) updated
item.dc:creator: pcdinh
item.description: An example: ​http://www.whatsonxiamen.com/?cat=.

item.title: Ticket #2758 (Security issue: cat parameter is vunerable to sql injection) updated
item.dc:creator: pcdinh
item.description:
Component changed

My solution: In wp-includes/query.php, before $qcat? = .urldecode($qcat?).; I add:

$qcat? = intval($qcat?);

Thanks

item.title: Ticket #2758 (Security issue: cat parameter is vunerable to sql injection) created
item.dc:creator: pcdinh
item.description:
To get the content of a specific category I can request the following url:

​http://www.path.com/wordpress/?cat=3

But when I try to send a request to ​http://www.path.com/wordpress/?cat=. and unexpected error returns

WordPress database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near ') AND (post_type = 'post' AND (post_status = 'publish')) ORDER BY post_date DES' at line 1] SELECT DISTINCT wp_posts.* FROM wp_posts LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat ON (wp_posts.ID = wp_post2cat.post_id) WHERE 1=1 AND category_id IN (.) AND (post_type = 'post' AND (post_status = 'publish')) ORDER BY post_date DESC LIMIT 0, 10

What does WHERE 1=1 AND category_id IN (.) mean here?

So I think that we should check cat parameter against int value to prevent Wordpress from returning such errors.

Applicable to WP 2.0.2 and WP 2.1 alpha1

Thanks

item.title: Ticket #2470 (<strike> sucks, <del> does not) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Same problem with <ins> ... currently, you can't use <ins> as block level in WP.
